news_header: A study captures sharks' behavior as they coordinate attacks on prey.
news_original_title: This bird’s eye view of a shark hunt won a photo contest
news_text: Behavioral biologists Angela Albi and August Paula from the Max Planck Institute of Animal Behavior studied how blacktip reef sharks interact with each other and their prey. They captured an aerial image of a school of hardyhead silverside fish fleeing from four juvenile blacktip reef sharks near the Maldives. The snapshot won the 2024 Royal Society Publishing Photography Competition, highlighting the social nature of these sharks and their potential coordinated hunting strategies.
